metadata.dc:author: Carregal Rañó, A
Román Fernández, A
Pereira Loureiro, M Á
Vilanova Vázquez, V
Corujeira Rivera, M C
López Álvarez, A
metadata.dc:description: We present the case of a 77 year-old patient scheduled for coronary artery bypass. During the infusion of levosimendan as preconditioning for surgery, a rupture of right common iliac artery occurred. Surgery was delayed and an urgent aorto-bifemoral bypass was performed. We believe that the rupture of the artery was triggered by an increase in transmural pressure due to the inotropic effects of levosimendan in a dilated diseased vessel. To our knowledge, there are no cases of aneurysm rupture as a complication during levosimendan infusion, but the coincidence of events in time strongly suggests some kind of causal relationship.
metadata.dc:subject: Rotura de aneurisma
Aneurysm rupture

metadata.dc:title: Rotura de aneurisma ilíaco durante el precondicionamiento con levosimendán previo a cirugía de revascularización coronaria.
[Iliac aneurysm rupture during preconditioning with levosimendan for coronary artery bypass graft].
metadata.dc:publisher: Revista espanola de anestesiologia y reanimacion
